oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Memorial tree plates of Chattanooga veterans
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: These small copper plaquards were designed to be tacked to trees as a memorial to WWI veterans from the Chattanooga area. They were apparently never installed. Twenty servicemen are represented with the following last names: Donahoo, Leamon, Holdam, Hunt, Meroney, Waller, Harrison, Mason, McCulouch, Orr, Cooper, Summers, Stegall, Camp, Gaffney, Garrison, Long, McCall, and Kell. The names represent personnel from all brances of service. The plates were registered with the American Forestry Association.
